text: Slacking from my phone!
Hey! Me too!
IM going to try a “slack as Honey” experiment
<http://furbo.org/2014/03/13/wearing-apple/>
an interesting look at all the reasons Apple probably won’t launch a watch
most of which I agree with and most of which I think are weirdly overlooked by other tech journalists
then again - the article also leans towards a “ring” device, which for my part, goes counter to much of the rest of the articles logic
i think the pebble is the closest to being the solution for a connected watch.
mine ran out of batteries the other day and i had to go without it for about half a day and i really did miss having it on my wrist.
yeah - I agree. I think the problem for apple would be how to make that a mass market product.
I like the pebble a lot, but I also think it’s pretty niche
if apple has a solve for battery life, i will switch
my pebble used to get ~8-9 days but since they released their app store which gave apps the ability to drain more battery life, i’m getting ~4-5 days on one charge
I will say this: I think if Apple WERE to make a watch, it’s functionality would be in the same conceptual space as the Pebble
like - basically an add on the iphone
with fairly limited functionality
with the rumors of all the biometric data that’s supposed to be collected with their new Healthbook suite of apps, i can’t help but to think that they’re going to make a watch with sensors built-in
yeah - there is that. Im really torn on that one. On the one hand, these are fairly persistent rumors - and there does seem to be more and more to back up Apples interest in health
then again, we know they’re interested in TV too - and look how slow that’s been
and I think health related stuff is a huge cultural challenge - especially in the US
true
so I believe they’re for sure working on that stuff, I guess Im not convinced it’s imminent
I think Healthbook is the canary for them
a cheap way to start some real world testing
I think the iWatch is going to have sensor needles that stick into your arm to get biometric readings
that’s really the best way to do it
agreed
I don’t know where exactly to post the link Im about to share. It’s right at the intersection of True Detective and Design. I guess I’ll post it both places with the disclaimer: SPOILERS!
<http://www.wekeeptheotherbadmenfromthedoor.com/#intro>

slack's fate at Uncorked
its going to happen!
i think it's actually catching on...
the kijiji channel is GOIN OFF!
i like slack, just didn't want to miss the opportunity to make a mean girls reference .
the TD channel is whats up today
i feel like the general and the random channel should be merged into one. don't know if that's possible.
yeah - I agree
I think we might just have to delete it
it was there by default
nice
archived
How do I unfriend Slackbot? I hate him.
I don't like him either.
You cannot leave slackbot
Slackbot will always be with you
just click the x next to his name
and you will always be with him
i nixed him
or that
he’s like Clippy reincarnated
I haven’t even noticed it
what does it do?
not much
people are just very sensitive
it does have the same creepy eyes that clippy had
he looks into our souls
he messages you sometimes, which i feel is an invasion of my personal space
i think you can get slackbot to do stuff with integrations
but i dont know what yet.

oh and i guess you can set reminders: "Conversations with Slackbot are a good place to ask the bot to remind you of something, such as “/remind me in 2 days to turn in my expense report” or “/remind me in 30 minutes to eat something.” At default settings, the reminder pops up with a sound cue. If you miss the popup, you’ll still get a note in your conversation thread. "
interesting
I did not know that - thats sorta cool actually
